Detailed Description

A reference to all "streamable" data formats (AMR, PCM, MP3)

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef UINT32 StreamAudioReference::BufferByteType
 

typedef AudioPlayer::Buffer StreamAudioReference::BufferType
 

typedef AudioPlayer::ConstBuffer StreamAudioReference::ConstBufferType
 

typedef AudioPlayer::GetAudioBufferFunction StreamAudioReference::GetAudioBufferFunction
 

Definition of the function to be invoked by the driver to retrieve the buffer pointer and the size when the mode is set to MmfMedia. See CreateStream().

Parameters:
audio_buffer,: The buffer
size,: The size of the buffer
pUserData,: The application specific data
Note:
The Multimedia Framework (MMF) is responsible for allocating and handling the audio buffers required for audio record and playback. The audio driver invokes this function periodically to retrieve the audio data. During playback, the audio driver invokes this function, when the audio data has to be retrieved to playback. It is also invoked when the audio data from the previous buffer has been played and is time to retrieve a new buffer with new audio data. During recording, the audio driver invokes the provided function to retrieve an empty buffer along with the buffer size, to store the recorded data. When the current buffer is about to be finished, the audio driver invokes this function once again to retrieve a new buffer. The buffer address and the buffer size should be returned immediately by MMF, else synchronization will be lost. The buffer size should be at least one frame data. The callback function is called until the application explicitly call either StreamAudioPlayer::StopRecord() or AudioActiveReference::Stop() functions or if the size of the buffer returned by the callback function is 0 and the buffer is different from NULL. If a NULL pointer is returned as the buffer pointer, then the play/record will not be stopped, a noise might be heard in that case and the function will be called again

The buffer must at least have a size so it can hold data for one frame.
For PCM one frame max. is 1280 bytes, for AMR one frame max is 34 bytes, and for MP3 it is 1042 bytes.
To ensure that the client has enough time to copy data to the buffer a bigger buffer is however needed. On the other side the buffer should not take up the entire RAM, i.e. the buffer size should be a trade off between RAM usage and time for the client to finish coping data to the buffer. Data equivalent to 100 msec would properly be an OK compromise, i.e. for the worst case scenario which would be PCM 48 kHz 16 bit stereo, the buffer size should be 20480 bytes.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum StreamAudioReference::DspFormat
 

DSP Formats.

Enumerator:
PcmDspFormat  PCM.
AdpcmDspFormat  ADPCM (not yet supported).
WaveDspFormat  Wave (only PCM).
FrDspFormat  AMR Full Rate.
AmrDspFormat  Adaptive Multi-Rate.
MP3DspFormat  MP3.
A2dpFormat  Bluetooth Advanced Audio Distribution Profile.

enum StreamAudioReference::Media
 

Media Types.

Enumerator:
FfsMedia  Record or Play the memo to/from the Flash File System.
MmcMedia  Record or Play the memo to/from MMC (might not be supported by the hardware).
RamMedia  Record or Play the memo to/from RAM buffer. See SetSampleRate().
RfsMedia  Record or play the memo to/from RFS.
MmfMedia  Record or playback using multimedia framework.

enum StreamAudioReference::Mode
 

Modes.

Enumerator:
StandbyMode  Standby mode. Use this when no call is active.
TchMode  Traffic Channel mode. Use this during a call.

UINT32 StreamAudioReference::CalculateBufferSize (  UINT32  seconds,
DspFormat  format,
SampleRateType  rec_rate
)  [static]
 

Calculates the size of the buffer required by this format. This is just a convenience function. You could do the calculation yourself instead very easily.

Parameters:
seconds. The duration of the voice memo recording, in seconds.
format. See CreateRam().
rec_rate The Sample rate. See SetSampleRate().
Returns:
The required buffer size. Returns 0 if the input paramters were invalid.

Create a reference to data to be played from, or recorded to, a Root File System file.

Parameters:

mode,: Sound format of the data.
format,: Decoder used.
Returns:
A pointer to StreamAudioReference.
This function is used for an Stream Audio Reference creation in RFS. This function supports FFS and MMC . This function should be called instead of CreateFFS.

SharedPtr< StreamAudioReference > StreamAudioReference::CreateStream (  Mode  mode,
DspFormat  format,
GetAudioBufferFunction  func,
void *  user_data = 0
)  [static]
 

Create a reference to audio data to be played or recorded in streaming mode

Parameters:
mode,: The play/recording mode (ignored in case of MP3 data)
format,: Used decoder.
func,: The callback function given during the initialization of the stream reference will be called by the driver to fetch new data.
user_data,: The application specific data. Neither APOXI nor driver will alter this data.
Returns:
A pointer to StreamAudioReference.
An example how to playback a streaming reference is shown bellow: 
 // The MMF side implements a class that will handle the callback function

 class StreamingPlayback
 {
    public:
    // This is the function called by the driver
    static void OnStreamingGetBuffer(UINT8** audio_buffer, UINT16* size, void* pUserData);
 };

 void StreamingPlayback::OnStreamingGetBuffer(UINT8** audio_buffer, UINT16* size, void* pUserData)
 {
 // fill in the buffer and pass back the control to the driver as fast as possible
 }

 //Create a streaming reference to the sound:
 SharedPtr<StreamAudioReference> stream_ref =  StreamAudioReference::CreateStream(mode, dsp_format, &StreamingPlayback::OnStreamingGetBuffer);
 SharedPtr<AudioReference> p_ref = SharedPtr<AudioReference>(&(*stream_ref)); // manual cast because SharedPtr & compiler can't do it

 //Get the appropiate player
 AudioPlayer* p_player = AudioDeviceManager::GetInstance().GetAudioPlayer(*p_ref);

 //Ask the AudioPlayer to play it with an appropriate Player:
 SharedPtr<AudioActiveReference> playing_ref = AudioDeviceManager::Play(*p_ref);
 After starting the playback the OnStreamingGetBuffer will be called by the driver
 // After a while you can call
 if(playing_ref) //If a suitable player was available and the play started successfuly.
 {
   //Pass the playing_ref around and eventually say:
   playing_ref->Stop();
 }

SharedPtr< StreamAudioReference > StreamAudioReference::CreateVoiceRecognition (   )  [static]
 

Create a reference to audio data to be recorded for voice recognition

Returns:
A pointer to StreamAudioReference.
The reference created should only be used for recording. An example how to record is shown bellow: 
  SharedPtr<StreamAudioReference> vr_ref = StreamAudioReference::CreateVoiceRecognition();

  StreamAudioPlayer* p_player = (StreamAudioPlayer*)AudioDeviceManager::GetInstance().GetAudioPlayer(*vr_ref);

  SharedPtr<AudioActiveReference> p_play_ref = p_player->Record(*vr_ref);

  //Due to some OS limitations regarding usage of semaphores in the context oh HISR, the StreamAudioPlayer::StopRecord function
  //cannot be invoked from the callback function!!!
  //The posibilities to stop the recording session are as follows:
  // a) Pass 0 size and buffer different than NULL
  // b) Notify the application that it has to stop the recording
  //  PSEUDO_CODE (NOTIFY_APP_STOP_RECORDING)

Voice recognition data (training and recognition) is recorded in PCM format and can be played from RAM or file. PCM format for voice recognition is allways the same. Mode is mono, sample rate 8KHz, bit rate 16.
An example how to play from RAM and file is shown bellow: 
  //if playing from RAM use CreateRAM
  SharedPtr<StramAudioReference> vr_ref = StreamAudioReference::CreateRAM(buffer, buffer_size,
        StreamAudioReference::StandbyMode, StreamAudioReference::PcmDspFormat);

  //if playing from file use CreateFile
  SharedPtr<StramAudioReference> vr_ref = StreamAudioReference::CreateFile(file_name,
    StreamAudioReference::StandbyMode, StreamAudioReference::PcmDspFormat);

  //mono mode, sample rate 8KHz and bit rate 16 are default values so there is no need to set them

  SharedPtr<AudioActiveReference> p_play_ref = AudioDeviceManager::Play(*vr_ref);

  //Playback can be stopped in this way:

  p_play_ref->Stop();

StreamAudioReference::BufferByteType StreamAudioReference::GetRecordedSize (   ) 
 

Returns the number of the recorded bytes in buffer. (Only valid if recording). When streaming mode is selected then it will provide the number of bytes that have been recorded in the last buffer passed through the callback function. See GetAudioBufferFunction.

StreamAudioReference::SampleRateType StreamAudioReference::GetSampleRate (   )  const
 

See SetSampleRate().

BOOLEAN StreamAudioReference::HasAudio (   )  const
 

Returns a flag that specifies whether the reference will provide any audio data to be played or not. See MmfCreateStream()

Returns:
Returns TRUE when data will be given to be rendered

void StreamAudioReference::InitDataOffset (   )  [protected]
 

SharedPtr< StreamAudioReference > StreamAudioReference::MmfCreateStream (  Mode  mode,
DspFormat  format,
GetAudioBufferFunction  func,
void *  user_data = 0,
BOOLEAN  has_audio = TRUE
)  [static]
 

Create a reference to audio data to be played or recorded in streaming mode

Parameters:
mode,: The play/recording mode (ignored in case of MP3 data)
format,: Used decoder.
func,: The callback function given during the initialization of the stream reference will be called by the driver to fetch new data.
pUserData,: The application specific data. Neither APOXI nor driver will alter this data.
hasAudio,: Indicates whether the newly created reference has audio data attached or not. Setting this value to FALSE is a very special
case when for instance a .3gp file that contains video only is played. The creation of audio reference is still necessary to be able to prioritize this playback.
Returns:
A pointer to StreamAudioReference.

BOOLEAN StreamAudioReference::OpenFile (   )  [protected]
 

void StreamAudioReference::SetMonoStereoMode (  MonoStereoType  val  ) 
 

Sets the MonoSteroMode

DspFormat::PcmDspFormat

0: PCM data are in stereo
1: PCM data are in mono (default)
2: PCM data are in mono, but they should be played in both left and right channel

DspFormat::AdpcmDspFormat(Not yet supported)

To be defined

DspFormat::AmrDspFormat - Not supported

void StreamAudioReference::SetRecordedSize (  BufferByteType  rec_size  )  [protected]
 

void StreamAudioReference::SetRecordingRate (  SampleRateType  val  ) 
 

Sets the recording rate(obsolete, use SetSampleRate instead)

void StreamAudioReference::SetSampleRate (  SampleRateType  val  ) 
 

Sets the sample rate.

Parameters:
val The sample rate depending on the data type.
Default value is 0. This value is only used when recording the PCM and AMR data and playing raw PCM data. When playing data like MP3, Wave or AMR the information about sample rate is in the header and this value is ignored.

DspFormat::PcmDspFormat

0: 8 kHz
1: 11.025 kHz
2: 12 kHz
3: 16 kHz
4: 22.05 kHz
5: 24 kHz
6: 32 kHz
7: 44.1 kHz
8: 48 kHz

For PCM record: Only 8 kHz and 16 kHz(not yet supported) are possible

DspFormat::AdpcmDspFormat(Not yet supported)

To be defined

DspFormat::AmrDspFormat only used for recording, see the bellow table
RateSampling rate [kBit/sec]Bytes pr. Speech frameBytes pr. Sec.Bytes pr. Minute
04,751365038,1 KB
15,151470041,0 KB
25,901680046,9 KB
36,701890052,7 KB
47,4020100058,6 KB
57,9521105061,5 KB
610,2027135079,1 KB
712,2032160093,8 KB
Full rateFull rate34170099,6 KB
